title: SOLD: 1888 Old Judge N172 Buck Ewing #149-10 BEATER
author: Smanzari

posts.post_title: SOLD: 1888 Old Judge N172 Buck Ewing #149-10 BEATER
posts.post_content:
For sale is am 1888 Old Judge N172 #149-10 Buck Ewing. Purchased this here a few weeks ago, in hopes to grade. Card is an absolute BEATER but is a 19th Century Card of a Pretty Significant HOFer - it is Extremely Trimmed (no borders), has Marks, Stains, is skinned, has a mega-crease of which it is fragile around, etc. Seems like SGC believes it is authentic, but deemed it too fragile to holder (Not sure about the other TPAs)

[Strike]Asking $375 OR BEST OFFER Shipped.[/Strike] SOLD 

[URL=https://imageshack.com/i/po5ni1AAj][IMG]https://imagizer.imageshack.com/v2/640x480q70/924/5ni1AA.jpg[/IMG][/URL][URL=https://imageshack.com/i/pom6HuJfj][IMG]https://imagizer.imageshack.com/v2/640x480q70/924/m6HuJf.jpg[/IMG][/URL]
[URL=https://imageshack.com/i/pmvVrnZSj][IMG]https://imagizer.imageshack.com/v2/640x480q70/922/vVrnZS.jpg[/IMG][/URL][URL=https://imageshack.com/i/pnn6HXe1j][IMG]https://imagizer.imageshack.com/v2/640x480q70/923/n6HXe1.jpg[/IMG][/URL]
I might try CSG to AA slab it. A couple years ago, PSA wouldn't slab a 1928 Star Player Collins trimmed down that they previously did but CSG did :confused:
